abstract: The $3.7 billion bid to privatize Nasdaq-listed and Shanghai-based Focus Media, a leveraged buyout backed by private equity and management, is the biggest deal in a rising wave of Chinese companies seeking to delist from American exchanges.
snippet: The $3.7 billion bid to privatize Nasdaq-listed and Shanghai-based Focus Media, a leveraged buyout backed by private equity and management, is the biggest deal in a rising wave of Chinese companies seeking to delist from American exchanges.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG–Fed up with slumping share prices, prickly regulators and aggressive short sellers, Chinese companies listed on American stock exchanges are increasingly heading for the exits.

headline.main: Chinese Companies Head for the Exit

abstract: A series that looks at how relatives of top Chinese officials have amassed vast wealth through businesses closely entwined with the state.
snippet: A series that looks at how relatives of top Chinese officials have amassed vast wealth through businesses closely entwined with the state.
lead_paragraph: A series that looks at how relatives of top Chinese officials have amassed vast wealth through businesses closely entwined with the state.
